required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: a Phase III Trial of Safety and Efficacy of Premedication With Dexmedetomidine and Midazolam in Pediatric Patients
clinical_study.official_title: A Partially Double-Blinded, Randomized, Controlled, Placebo-Controlled Study, a Phase III Trial of Safety and Efficacy of Premedication With Dexmedetomidine and Midazolam in Pediatric Patients

lead_sponsor.agency: King Faisal Specialist Hospital & Research Center

clinical_study.source: King Faisal Specialist Hospital & Research Center

brief_summary.textblock: This research study to evaluate the relative efficacy of Dexmedetomidine, Midazolam, and compare them to the current KFSH&RC standard of care. Compare the safety and the frequency of adverse effects of treatment arms.

primary_outcome.description: Comparison of the level of anxiety as measured by The Modified Yale Preoperative Anxiety Scale - Short Form (mYPAS-SF) at the time when the child checks in at the front desk (say mYPAS-SF1), with when the attempt will be made to insert an IV line (say mYPAS-SF2). This scale is a score ranging from four (little anxiety) to twenty two (much anxiety).

The systolic and diastolic blood pressures will be measured when the subject enters the recovery room, and then each ten minutes until the subject goes into the MRI suite and general anesthesia is induced.
The respiratory rate will be measured when the subject enters the recovery room, and then each ten minutes until the subject goes into the MRI suite and general anesthesia is induced.
The SpO2 will be measured when the subject enters the recovery room, and then each ten minutes until the subject goes into the MRI suite and general anesthesia is induced.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All pediatric outpatients coming for MRI investigations requiring general anesthesia at King Faisal Specialist Hospital & Research Center (KFSH&RC) age 1-12 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- Weight â‰¥ 40 kilograms
- Allergies to the study drug
- Refused to take the study drug
- Severe learning disability
- Patient on Digoxin medication
- Cardiac disease with abnormal conduction system
- Nasal anatomical abnormality

facility.name: King Faisal Specialist Hospital & Research Center

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: King Faisal Specialist Hospital & Research Center
